projects.title: Dropwise
projects.description: Dropwise is a smart oil meter for home and industrial use. Created the firmware for the Texas Instruments MSP432 microcontroller in C++ which tracks the precise usage of oil, pushes data to InfluxDB via MQTT broker. Written the backend in JavaScript and was responsible for creating a prediction algorithm based on previous usage and other external factors. Created a PWA frontend using React to display metrics. Wrote an API for oil suppliers to integrate with the system.

projects.title: Asylum & Immigration CI Team
projects.description: Joined a newly formed continuous improvement team for Her Majesty's Courts and Tribunals Service - Asylum and Immigrations in an attempt to boost the throughput of critical requirements being implemented, reducing the backlogged items in the value stream and getting them into production. Maintained a multitude of microservices to provide online case appeal services to the public.

projects.title: Loki
projects.description: Loki is a serverless ETL tool for normalising multi source data into a single source of truth. Implemented the concept in python on the serverless framework which deploys as AWS lambdas. Extracts and transforms the data into an in-house purpose built PostgreSQL single source of truth database for analysis by the data scientists.

projects.title: Electronic Visa Waiver
projects.description: Full-stack development for the Home Office - Electronic Visa Waiver project. Working on the customer facing part of the project, updating legacy code to a more modern express, whilst maintaining the GDS styling. Migrating to the application container platform (ACP) built to run GOV projects.
